page.title: 16CLUBS
page.content: {WOMENS INSTITUTE (cont). } In 1952 Mobberley W.I. entered a competition organised by Cheshire Federation and won first prize with a book entitled 'A History of Mobberley' which was later published. {MORRIS DANCERS. } The Ringheye Morris Troupe derive their name from the old Parish in which Ringway is located. Ringheye is also the name of a dance movement. The Morris dancers practice in Pepper Street Chapel every Wednesday evening. They are a mixed team and wear clogs following the tradition of the N.West. They have been instrumental in reviving some of the old customs of the area. They have written and perform a 'Souling Play' which takes place on November 1st and they would also like to revive the custom of 'Crabbing' the Parson.
